context: The Estonian word 'rakett' has multiple meanings depending on context. It can refer to 1) fireworks or pyrotechnic devices used for celebrations, illumination, or signaling; 2) an aerospace vehicle powered by a rocket engine for space exploration or scientific purposes; or 3) in military contexts, a missile equipped with warheads used as weapons. The word appears in compound terms specifying the type of rocket such as 'valgustusrakett' (illumination rocket), 'kosmose|rakett' (space rocket), or 'tuumalaenguga raketid' (nuclear-equipped missiles).
